title.narrative: Fair Finance Asia - Sida - Japan Progr

description.narrative:
The Fair Finance Asia Program (FFA) envisages to reduce the negative impact of national and cross-border bank investments in Asia on human rights, the environment and climate change, and to increase adequate financial services for pro-poor, inclusive economic development. The goal is to establish a sustainable financial sector in Asia, with financial sector institutions operating at national and regional level being more transparent and accountable and adhering to Economic, Social and Governance (ESG)-criteria. FFA is funded by SIDA.
In Japan implementation will be led by JACSES, an experienced independent non-profit policy research centre for a sustainable and just society that is currently leading the Fair Finance Guide Japan coalition and was involved in the Fair Finance GuideInternational and Fair Financial Flows programmes. JACSES is leading organization and is implementing policy assessments. PARC is managing the website and is coordinating case studies. A SEED JAPAN is coordinating communication work through public events. APLA ismanaging the Facebook page.
In addition to the above groups, Friend of the Earth Japan, Amnesty International Japan, Mekong Watch,Japan Tropical Forest Action Network (JATAN) and Green Economy Forum are supporting members for the coalition. We have cooperated with them at case studies and public events.

participating-org.narrative: JACSES, Japan Center for Sustainable Environment and Society, is an NGO, dedicated to achieving sustainable development and social justice by engaging the general public and experts in research, policy advocacy, and awareness-raising. JACSES# activities are centered around the Sustainable Development and Aid Program (SDAP), which is aimed at improving Japanese government#s development aid projects in developing countries; the Green Tax Reform, which advocates the introduction of fiscal instruments (such as carbon taxes and emission trading schemes) to address environmental problems, as well as the integration of environmental concerns into economic activities; and climate change, which advocates a comprehensive approach to climate policy reforms. JACSES leads the Fair Finance Guide Coalition in Japan. JACSES has a good network amongst several NGO's, amongst which Green Finance Watch and BankTrack.
Japan Center for a Sustainable Environment and Society (JACSES)

description.narrative: Improved policies Governments and global actors: # cases (sub)national governments or global actors adopting and/or implementing improved gender sensitive policies on promotion of a transparent, accountable and inclusive financial sector.
cases (sub)national governments or global actors adopting and/or implementing improved gender sensitive policies on promotion of a transparent, accountable and inclusive financial sector -DD2

comment.narrative: 1- Japanese government's policy to end new direct international government support for unabated coal-fired power generation 2-‘Japan's Proposal on MDBs’ Support in the Energy Sector’ published by MoFJ, stating their support for MDB’s decision not to support new coal projects.

comment.narrative: We counted here the number of assessed FIs who improved their scores: Mizuho, SMBC, Resona, Sumitomo Mitsui Trust Bank, Norinchukin Bank, Japan Post Bank, Kanpo, Dai-ichi Life, Nippon Life, Meiji Yasuda Life, Sumitomo Life, Tokio Marine, and MS&AD.
